ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed an appreciation and understanding of Deaf Culture and Deaf Awareness, as well as how to properly and politely communicate with deaf people.
Learned a lot about ASL and Deaf culture

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths- the c;ass is structured to help students learn and also succeed
Less outside of class hours (service hours not homework)

A strength of this course is that you can engage find ways to engage with the material outside of class because of the ASL community. However, the required hours for this class are hard to complete if your generally a busy person, and the events clash with your schedule. I think a way to improve this would be to make the requirement less hours or to make the events during the asynchronous class times.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absoultuely. It is one of the best and most fulfilling classes at Yale.
